meanings.definition: Lack of ability to move or act
meanings.sent1: The inertnesses of the rock made it impossible to roll down the hill.
meanings.sent2: The cat's inertnesses after a big meal were quite noticeable as it lazed in the sun.
meanings.sent3: The inertnesses of the remote control resulted in a comical struggle to change the channel.
meanings.sent4: The inertnesses of the old car engine mirrored the stagnation in the town's economy.
meanings.sent5: The inertnesses of the sloth were so extreme that it moved only once a day to eat.

meanings.definition: State of being inactive or motionless
meanings.sent1: The pond's inertnesses were disturbed only by the occasional ripple from a passing duck.
meanings.sent2: The winter's cold brought an inertnesses to the garden, with no flowers blooming.
meanings.sent3: The inertnesses of the clock's hands made time seem to stand still.
meanings.sent4: The inertnesses of the abandoned factory echoed the decline of the once-thriving industry.
meanings.sent5: The inertnesses of the desert landscape gave an eerie sense of timelessness.
